title: Not good
body: I’ve been with the doctors for over 4 months and still not been able to get a appointment I suffer really bad with anxiety and having no help

author: os53
title: NHS 111 angels
body:
I had a sudden extreme pain in my abdomen which lasted non stop for an hour. I called 111 when I couldn't shake the pain and was advised to go to A&E. During my initial pain and after in total I called 3 times and each time 111 gave me solid advice and listened intently and sympathetically.  
They gave me better advice than my local A&E and I'm truly grateful for the staff at 111. It is unfortunate that I live in a borough where health care appears to be at the very bottom of the national list but you take what life decides to give you.

title: Always the best practice
body:
Combined Covid and flu vaccination session yesterday, and, as always, everything ran smoothly. Staff are polite, friendly and professional. They always have a smile on their faces even in the toughest of times. And working on a Saturday.
A great practice, we are so lucky to have them.

title: Very efficient
body: All went very smoothly. Quick and efficient. Doctor and receptionists very pleasant . Very well organised couldn't find anything wrong with the treatment i recieved.

title: Great Nursing Staff
body: In a world full of negativity at the moment, I thought I had to write in to say what an asset to the medical centre the phlebotomist is.  This site does not allow me to mention her name unfortunately.  Despite all the changes of ownership, covid and staff changes, she has been a "constant" throughout. She always welcomes me with a happy positive attitude and her knowledge and skill set is appreciated. From someone who had a phobia of needles I can say that she has changed my perception to giving blood. She is caring and reassuring and actually listens to her patients, which seems rare these days. I hope she remains with the Great Denham Medical Centre as she is a credit to the team.

title: Exceptional service
body: The antenatal and delivery unit today provided us with exceptional service. All the staff and particularly the midwives were extremely polite and supremely professional and a credit to the NHS and moreover a credit to society. Knowledgeable, caring, empathetic, highly professional are just a few of the adjectives to describe them. 5 star service and highly recommended - thank you very much!

title: 5* surgery
body:
Seen in clinic today. Thank you so much for the care you give & for always going that extra mile
Keeling house staff you are a wonderful caring team. Thank you so much for all you do

title: 5* surgery
body:
Seen in clinic today. Thank you so much for the care you give & for always going that extra mile
Keeling house staff you are a wonderful caring team. Thank you so much for all you do

title: Fantastic service
body: Always great service from reception, nurses and Dr's. Can't fault this practice. When you hear the horror stories from other people about the practices they are registered with. Keep up the good work, you are all appreciated.

title: Very supportive team
body: I have called and visited Springhouse numerous times over about a decade. Of course they can’t magic appointments up when not javailable, however they are very attentive to patients needs. For example they called me recently with a late cancellation. They often give you the extra time and reassure you when you need it most. I am most appreciative of the reception team, doctors, nurses and pharmacists. I have found staff in all these roles go over and above to help you .

title: Flu jab
body:
I had a text asking me to comment on my experience on Saturday, but the link didn't work. Just to say, the whole experience was so easy. I was in and out in less than five minutes. The staff were efficient and so friendly.
Well done all

title: Good experience
body: My son was in A and E with anaphalactic shock. The staff were brilliant and supportive to my son and myself.  He had to stay in 5 days and the staff on ward 22 were equally lovely and supportive. Thankyou

title: triage failure
body: Following a telephone call for advice on 7th october 2022 I received a text message advising me a referral had been sent to the community pharmacist who would be in touch within 24  hours to discuss my issue. four days later I am still waiting  - in the meantime having been forced to go to accident and emergency department at hospital this pharmacy is incompetent and not fit for purpose and reflects badly on the gp practice.

title: Positive, well informed and friendly experience
body:
I attended the Breast Care / Screening Assessment Clinic in Charing Cross Hospital on 3/10/22 and received the very best of service, I could not ask for more.

Was met by the friendliest nurse ever, a fabulous communicator. Then a nurse took my details, a great listener and explained everything clearly and ensured I understood and had the opportunity to ask questions.

Had another mammogram (ladies were very efficient and caring) and then ultrasound. All was clear and a good outcome for me.

The team were just fabulous in every way. I can't praise them highly enough.

Please pass on my thanks

title: Fabulous care
body: From the moment I booked in at A&E to the Dr's, Nurses, HCA and Housekeeping staff you were all amazing. I really don't know how you all cope. The A&E was full to the rafters, the nursing staff were fantastic, to have to deal with that on a daily basis must be demoralising. I was on a trolley bed for hours before being admitted to the cardiac ward. First time at the county & i had  fabulous  care. Thank you one & all.

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: Extremely Friendly and Professional
body: I went to the Alexandra Hospital for a day operation.  I cannot fault the service I received.  Everyone was so friendly and helpful and made me feel at ease.

title: Very efficient
body: Arrived a little early but was taken in almost immediately and was back out within a few minutes. Friendly staff

title: Efficient , skilful treatment.
body:
I have no complaint with the treatment, but with the address which says enter by Entrance C , London Road. It is possible to get to the Osmaston Road Urgent -treatment clinic from there during the day, but not to get back to the car park after the double doors have been closed at 6.00pm. My 83 year-old husband with poor mobility,  and myself had to go back to the Osmaston Rd clinic, and order a taxi to the London Road car park! 
Surely there should be a clear notice about when the doors back into the Nightingale are locked? After having had an accident, the last thing you want to find is that you really needed to have entered via  the Osmaston Road entrance.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good Practice
body: The Doctor and admin lady were brilliant when I had my visit for Covid/flu vaccines.  The process was very quick.

title: Amazing service
body: I had a planned C section where I started off in Dosa then I was taken to theatre then postnatal ward. From admission to discharge I had an amazing time. I was treated with respect and dignity the staff were so patient and compassionate as I was so nervous. My anaesthetist was so good with me. The surgeon was fantastic I loved the experience. The midwives on the ward after were very busy but were happy to help and even take photos when my older child came to visit. I was so nervous and anxious about going in as i had an awful experience at another hospital with my first child. Thank you to all the nurses, midwives, ODP's, anaesthetist and the consultant.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very efficient
body: I visited for a double vaccination and expected some delay as it is evidently a very busy time. I was however pretty much straight in and out in less than five minutes, the only down side was I didn’t have time to open my book, lol!

title: Good practice
body:
Well organised covid & flu vaccinations: confirmed details; 2 min wait then 2 jabs; suggested covid jab in opposite shoulder to writing hand (well advised!) Then out
Thanks for organising promptly as cases starting to rise again

title: Good Doctors
body: I phoned the surgery to get an appointment with a lady doctor and was given an appointment four weeks ahead . On thinking about what was wrong with me, I decided I would like to have  a telephone conversation with a doctor and was told I couldn’t have one until three weeks time. Then I had to explain to the  receptionist, in detail, why I wanted some advice sooner and was given a next day appointment.  The Doctor was extremely helpful and put me at my ease. So my review would be that once you get past the receptionist the Doctor is great.

title: Great practice
body: Always able to get an appointment. Friendly, patient team, from reception through nursing and GPs. Thanks

title: Flu Vaccinations
body:
Incredible organisation and friendly staff made the Saturday morning vaccination session feel like a party - I was quite sorry we were in and out in 5 minutes! 
Well done all - it was amazing.

title: Amazing care and experience
body: I came out of the Friarage on 7th October after my foot reconstruction surgery.  The care that I received from the surgeon, anesthetist, nurses, physios and all other staff on Gara ward was absolutely amazing.  Nothing was too much. I left the hospital feeling confident that I could manage at home which I was really worried about as I have to be non weight bearing for 8 weeks. Thank you to everyone who looked after me. Your kindness and support has been much appreciated.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Well organised
body: Purpose of visit was for covid vaccination for disabled wife and myself . Helpful and speedy and unstressed service was provided

title: No contact!
body: Despite ongoing problems with my knee and heel I haven't heard a word from the practice since I went for an x-ray on the 24 August. This is very poor, at least I would expect a phone call to follow up on my x-ray, but no, nothing. It is now the 09 October and I wait in vain. I thought this surgery was better than this.

title: Flu jab
body: Although I had an appointment and was very early I did not have to wait but went in immediately. Very streamlined!

title: Excellent practice
body: I've had truly great treatment at the practice in the 4 years I've been a patient. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend

title: Flu jab
body: What an easy and efficient process.  Hardly any wait, in and out before appointment time . Well done Cedars on  brilliant organisation.

title: Excellent service
body: Visited practice for flu and Covid vaccinations. Staff were incredibly professional and friendly. The process was very smooth.

title: caring practice
body: Very friendly and caring staff. Always helpful. Would recommend that people seriously consider registering with this practice

title: Great practice
body: Great practice very and well organised I recently visited for my Flu and Covid vaccination and everything was orderly and well done.

title: Generally good
body:
Friendly volunteer staff directed us to the room for our flu vaccination. Someone immediately took our particulars of name, date of birth etc. 
The nurse who gave the vaccination was very efficient. No problems.

title: Generally good
body:
Friendly volunteer staff directed us to the room for our flu vaccination. Someone immediately took our particulars of name, date of birth etc. 
The nurse who gave the vaccination was very efficient. No problems.

title: Excellent practice
body: Flu jab, no problems!  A short queue, no waiting and a painless experience and no after effects. Would recommend!

title: Such an practice organised
body: Received advance notice of appointment letter, then received actual appointment. Arrived at time given and joined small queue which progressed v quickly. Was in and out In 10 mins. Very efficient and totally organised.

title: Great service
body: Had my flu jab on Saturday and the process was quick and efficient as always. Well done to all the staff and volunteers who streamlined the process so well.

title: Super service
body: Great service, very efficient with lovely staff and fabulous volunteers.  We've been with this surgery for 4 years since moving to the area and always found everyone very helpful and friendly.

title: Friendly helpful staff
body: Been at this surgery for many years first class. Recently been in hospital and my liaison with the doctors surgery has been very good.

title: Great practice
body: Very quick and efficient organisation of vaccinating a lot of patients in a short time. I was out of the surgery before my appointment time.

title: Excellent practice
body: Attended for flu jab, queued for not more than a minute, in and out in quick time and no pain or after effects.

title: The best surgery around
body:
Always get an appointment, great doctors who are always personable and friendly. Nurses are a pleasure to deal with and reception staff always pleasant and helpful.
This is the best surgery I have used and due to house moves etc I have used a few! Well done Cedars

title: Well organised
body: The organisation of Covid booster & Flu jab both of which I had during the course of one week was done efficiently, all the staff involved were pleasant.

title: Flu vaccination
body: A fast and efficient service was provided.The staff and volunteers were friendly and helpful providing an almost painless experience.Thank you.

title: Good practice
body: It was all very efficient and well organised. This was for the winter flu jab. No long queues or waiting outside in the cold.

title: Such an practice organised
body: Received advance notice of appointment letter, then received actual appointment. Arrived at time given and joined small queue which progressed v quickly. Was in and out In 10 mins. Very efficient and totally organised.

title: Great experience
body: I had a flu jab. The whole experience was efficiently organized and pleasantly and painlessly carried out. Thank you.

author: All64
title: Access to a scan
body:
Today my elderly father had an appointment for a scan at Willow Green medical centre in Angmering West Sussex.  
Due to his health conditions and limited mobility he was supported by his own GP surgery to organise transport. The scan at Willow Green had been organised by University Sussex NHS Foundation Hospital.  
The transport crew were helpful and attentive and when they arrived at Willow Green they needed to access a wheelchair for my father.  
Unfortunately the medical centre did not have a wheelchair and the clinic room was to far for my father to walk to and the transport team could not leave their wheelchair. Therefore the appointment was cancelled and my father returned home.  
A further appointment for the scan is now going to be organised at the hospital. I really do not understand how an NHS facility does not have a wheelchair this is despicable and has had a significant impact on my father to now wait even longer for a scan.

author: Mr letdown again
title: Cancelled surgery again
body:
Rowley Hall Hospital yet again cancelled my spinal surgery at the last minute for a second time, due to them not having 3 test results on their system.  
Obviously if u have only called me for one ,why even let me waste my time, and why did they not check this?  
Has put me in a very bad position mentally and financially and now have to live in pain again and wait for another date which will prob be in the new year.

author: nitratejr78
title: Lack of help. Passed from pillar to post
body:
I filled out the 111 online form and was told I would get a call within 30 minutes of submitting my form. Finally after more than an hour I then got a call back and was told that I would have to go to the hospital and to arrive at a specific time (within half an hour) which I did promptly.  
After arrival at A&E I still had a wait of 2-3 hours before seeing a triage nurse. In my eyes it would have been just as easy to go to a and e in the first place and I would have nearly been 2 hours into my wait and 2 hours further along.  
Eventually I saw the triage nurse received a wrist band and had to wait to see a doctor. After another nearly 2 hours, I saw a doctor who I thought was helpful, this then proved not, because, after being prescribed with pain medication to pick up the next day, they had given me no pain relief to take me out of the pain I was currently in. I was no further forward. I came back to the North Devon District Hospital (NDDH) the following morning to pick up this prescription, to be told they hadn't got one for me and to go to A&E to find out what was going to happen.  
Got to A&E and was told I'd have to be re submitted and go through the whole process again so I was submitted, saw a triage nurse at who told me there was no record of me being there at all the previous evening.  
I now currently feel very let down by the NHS and feel as though I've been passed from one person to the next and still in pain.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: normarc84
title: GP staff behavior
body:
After answering questions by 111 online related to my symptoms, I was advised to contact my GP. My GP's website instructs to call before 11 am to make an appointment. I called within that time window. Individual answering the call reprimanded me, ignoring my words, told me I was wrong for filling in the form on 111 website, and I was wrong for calling for an appointment, impatiently expressing frustration at me that I could've booked my online consultation without calling them by using the website.  
As far as I am aware - and as indicated on clinic website - appointments can be made by telephone and online, so repeatedly admonishing me, the patient, is unacceptable, and only added further emotional stress to an already painful situation. After all, I had started by disclosing the physical pain and concern I was feeling about symptoms.  
Today's telephone experience is in line with the in-person experience. I would like to see training in professional manner/ "patient service" so that patients aren't made to feel they have sinned by seeking medical assistance.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: octoberpq73
title: Staff making assumptions about gender
body:
I have been to Treliske a couple of times for appointments and been treated as she/her. big shout out to the colonoscopy staff.  
I went recently to pick up a friend. She had fabulous care while there. I was trying to find her and asked a staff member for help. This staff member asked a couple of other staff if they new where my friend was, because this Gentleman was looking for her. Bear in mind I was dressed in only female clothing. Dress, tights, boots. It's all I wear since coming out 16 months ago.Come on Treliske the clothes give a clue to a persons gender, don't assume by things like voice.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: sagittariusqx96
title: Covid-19 booster and flu vaccination
body:
Got turned away when attending vaccine appt at Easterhouse. Said they were running 2 hours late and we would need to re-book the appt.  
I know that this has been happening for the past 2 weeks at Easterhouse. Surely they should not be sending out appts before they know they have sufficient staff in place for these sessions.  
Now having to wait another 4 weeks for appt. To me, this smacks of reducing waiting times falsely.

author: Bella14
title: Vaccination Centre Alistair McCoist Centre East Kilbride
body:
I visited the Alistair McCoist centre along with my husband in the hope that if it was not busy I could be vaccinated at the same time. My scheduled appointment was for later in the week.  
Although there were only a few people waiting to be vaccinated, the staff member in charge refused to fit me in. When I asked them to explain why they could not accommodate me they suggested that lots of people could turn up at any moment, and did I not know that the NHS gave appointment times for a reason.  
As an intelligent 60 year old woman I do not appreciate being spoken to like a 5 year child. There was absolutely no logical reason why I could not have been vaccinated today. It felt to me that being in charge had gone to this person's head.

title: Flu Vaccination
body: The practice provided a very quick and efficient service with helpful and friendly staff and volunteers.

title: Terrible phone signal
body: In this day and age surely someone in authority can sort out the mobile phone signal strength and upgrade mast to 4G.. and increase the hospital wi fi to accept WhatsApp calls..it is so unnecessary to keep taking up staff on wards time if you want to speak to a relative or visitor.. and the hospital reception staff are fielding calls too... really this isn't rocket science and would aid so many people including your very special staff.. Show you care and get something sorted!

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Well looked after
body: My child was in Bluebell Ward for two days and I was very impressed by the care. The team were helpful and informative and did their due diligence when it came to finding out what was wrong.

title: Very friendly, caring staff
body: As an inpatient I had ultrasound and Mrcp scans. All the staff were friendly and caring thus calming any nerves I had. Totally different to  my experience of a previous MRI scan at St Mary's, Sidcup.

title: Efficient GP
body:
Hi,  Efficient booking for a 3 year old child to see nurse. 

My feedback is there is no cycle parking at the practice.  Lots of car parking but not a single place to lock my bicycle up.

title: Flu vaccination
body: Our visit to the surgery to have our flu vaccinations was very straightforward. It was a very efficient process with no queuing.

title: not good
body: Following my GP's appointment, I had to give blood tests for which I had to book a different date. I went for repeated Blood tests on 3 different occasions (5/07/22, 9/07/22, and 18/08/22) for the same test but every time no results. On inquiry, the receptionist gave the reasons as blood sample lost or insufficient sample. When I called them after a few weeks to check on my last results, they called for a repeat test again towards the end of October which is ridiculous. On questioning, the receptionist said mistakes do happen. Mistakes happening repeatedly is an unacceptable excuse. This has been a very bad experience.

title: Great friendly practice
body: Staff are helpful and friendly always willing to go the extra mile. Covid and flu clinic was timely and well organised.

title: Great friendly practice
body: Staff are helpful and friendly always willing to go the extra mile. Covid and flu clinic was timely and well organised.

title: global clinic is a1
body: The NUH always late never ever on time whereas the Global Clinic 7 appointments in total always on time even early. Polite caring makes you feel they want you there whereas the NUH the total opposite.

title: Great Practice
body: I have always found the staff to be most helpful when I have needed to contact the practice. I have got an appointment when it was needed.

title: Flu vaccine
body: Well organised and plenty of staff around. Great doctors and usually able to get appointments the same day

title: Pleasant Environment
body: Really pleased with my recent flue and Covid jabs. Couldn’t how quick it was. I didn’t even have to queue. Thank you for being so efficient. I found it a very pleasant experience.

title: Good Practice
body: I received both vaccinations for covid and flu. The notifications were clear and simple to follow the instructions from the staff were helpful with questionnaires about health  problems so as to avoid extra health concerns.

title: Great practice
body: Very quick and efficient. I was in and out in minutes. Also good parking available. The staff were well organized and cheerful.l

title: Unable to get trough phone or book appointments
body: It is impossible to get to speak with someone over the phone, never mind having a face to face consultation. Disappointing and unsafe for patient putting health at risk.

title: Disgusting service
body: This surgery has an extremely inefficient and inaccessible 'system' for booking appointments. Good luck if you have any kind of neurodiverse condition, they don't care. Last week I was on hold for over an hour before the call was disconnected- twice. This week I gave up after calling 25 times and the call being disconnected and went in. Receptionist was extremely arrogant and uncaring. She did not apologise or sympathise, and simply contradicted me saying 'they are answering calls'. I have the proof on my phone that the phone system was not working again. The surgery acknowledges this is a problem on this very website. Why lie to me? Besides which, 3 of them were just chatting away doing nothing at all when I walked in. She then haughtily told me not to speak to her like that- I was calm in tone, I had not raised my voice, I was not making comments about her, I was explaining that was going on and I had a right to be upset. She did not care. World Mental Health day today! I made a complaint last week which surprise surprise, no-one has responded to and am still waiting for confirmation of whether a prescription has been renewed two weeks later. This surgery is an actual danger to health and the receptionists urgently need proper training. I cannot speak about the GPs as I never actually manage to speak to one.

title: Excellent care and very flexible
body: My doctor knew exactly what I was asking for, gave me a comprehensive explanation of the difficulty and prescribed treatment immediately, which I could pick up from the surgery at the same time. I was expecting to have to go to the walk-in clinic to get an immediate response but was delighted that all sorted in the GP surgery. Can’t recommend highly enough.

title: Good luck getting an appointment
body:
Called for appointment on opening time. Waited in the queue, got to number one in the queue, someone picked up and then immediately hung up. Called back and I was number 15 in the queue. 

I needed an appointment for my baby who had covid, was extremely weak and had a high temperature. I had already spoke to 111 who had left a message that I should be contacted within 6 hours based on her symptoms by my GP surgery. When I eventually got through I was told no appointments were available. 

Feeling highly stressed with lack of sleep and concern for my baby I managed to remain calm and politely insisted we be seen and that we couldn’t attend a walk-in Centre, as she advised, because all of us were Covid positive. 

The receptionist then found an appointment, somehow. 

This GP surgery is getting steadily worse. If they are unable to address the issues, whether that be GP staffing levels or some other problem, the least they need to do is explain this to us, the patients. 

Where is the communications strategy? Simply be up front with patients about the problems you are facing and how waiting lists and appointment availability is being tackled. Put it on your website or something. 

In the meantime, surely there’s a triage system? A baby with a high fever being looked after by two parents with Covid surely qualifies as a priority.

title: Great and exemplary service
body: Well organised with professional execution and very good listening ear with prompt handling and actioning of complaints

title: As efficient as ever!
body: Once again The Leiston Surgery delivered a smoothly efficient, friendly and professional ‘flu and COVID vaccination programme. We are so fortunate to have such an excellent team in the community!

title: Covid and flu jabs
body: Great service, no queues, straight through for both injections. Can’t fault it. Would recommend anyone to use this surgery for their covid and/or flu injections

title: Great service
body:
I had a recent Endoscopy procedure under the 2ww scheme
I am a very nervous patient
The Daycase Endoscopy Unit was clean and fresh
The welcome was friendly
The team provided professional service and thorough attention to medical details and checks
They were also very very kind and gave personal support to me
They made the procedure tolerable
You have a great team and provide a great service
Be proud

title: Caring practice
body: It was all organised very well with no waiting involved. The staff were friendly and helpful. All in all a positive experience.

title: Flu & COVID jab
body: Went for flu & COVID jab on Saturday. Couldn’t believe how quick it was all done. Very efficient & good experience. Thank you Queen St surgery

title: Well Organised
body:
Went for my flu & covid jabs.

The system in place was well thought out and I was in/out within 5 mins

author: slideyg35
title: Fantastic
body: Fantastic! Keep funding the NHS!

author: nitrateps85
title: Friendly and welcoming
body: I had a great experience at Richmond Road Medical Centre today - everyone was so friendly and welcoming and Dr Mehta gave me the most painless injection I have ever had! Thank you so much.

author: septemberpm67
title: Love the energy!
body: Love the energy, very cheery and welcoming!

title: Fab phlebotamist
body: I was thrilled to have my blood taken recently at St Margaret's, the service was excellent.  I waited only a minute and it didn't hurt- I was so relieved and happy, thank you so very very much.

author: yankeedn35
title: Experience
body: Thank you for my booster shot. It was quick and didn't hurt at all. It's great to know that free boosters are available - Covid is still with us bigtime, it's just not headline news anymore...

author: cricketnr95
title: Amazing
body: Amazing, very efficient and kind!

author: oscarmz93
title: Very friendly
body: Fast and efficient, very friendly.

author: capellamn34
title: Great experience
body: Great especially - no waiting time, just straight to the injection. Thank you, God Bless all of you!

author: tigercx84
title: Thank you!
body: I am so happy with my experience today! I don't have any complaints about it. Thank you.

author: atlasrf36
title: Quick and efficient
body: Very welcoming, quick and efficient. Thank you!

author: herculesmr78
title: Quick and simple
body: Quickest and simplest ever! In and out within 5 minutes (literally!)

title: Very helpful reception staff
body:
I had to ring to ask for my prescription to be recalled from my regular pharmacy (Ranmoor Pharmacy) which has been unable to open in the last week due to a nationwide shortage of pharmacists. The pharmacy will only be open from 9am-1pm on 3 days this week so I will be unable to get to it due to work.
The receptionist was extremely helpful, changing my regular pharmacy for me & marking it as urgent, due to my needing my medication shortly & the pharmacy being closed.
I have to say, I have never had a problem accessing either a telephone or in person appointment when I have needed one and the reception staff have always tried to help.

author: jiverq53
title: Absolutely brilliant
body: Great service, very fast and efficient. Well done!

author: augustdd98
title: Childrens covid boosters
body: Absolutely fantastic staff, especially philomena and fiona. Very caring and attentive towards my children.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: starjc69
title: Covid-19 Vaccine
body: All very smooth, efficient and friendly.

title: Great service
body: Extremely well organised. Very fast  and efficient service provided. No queues. Took less than 5 minutes from start to finish.

author: serpenscd44
title: No need to wait
body: The clinic was easy, no need to wait for too long to be seen!

title: Great efficient practice.
body:
Very efficient, better than I expected.
Previous experience was very slow, but has improved since.
The staff treated me very well - friendly and reassuring.
